pullRequest.title: Adding experimental build for multiple JUnit5 versions (#296)
pullRequest.bodyText:
There are still some things to discuss, or things which imho are not that great within that solution.

JUnitVersion actually is just the patch.minor version and not the whole version. This is due to the fact that JUnit platform and JUnit jupiter are using the same patch.minor version, but sadly not the major one. We could think of changing this to some logic in the build.gradle.kts. Nevertheless it will be a good solution in any case, in my opinion. Providing two properties is also not a good idea.
When to run, is it overkill to run this on pull request? i think we do not gain a lot by doing so. but it could be quiet interesting :)

Commit Message:
Adding experimental build for multiple JUnit5 versions (#296)

Adding additional GitHub Action Workflow to check our compatibility with past and future
versions of JUnit5. Currently we are supporting 5.5.0, 5.5.1, 5.5.2, 5.6.0, 5.6.1 and 5.6.2
in this workflow.

closes: #296 


I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Pioneer Contributor License Agreement.

commit.message:
Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* added new GitHub Action to run multiversion build

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* adapted build.gradle.kts to use new junitVersion property
* adding default gradle.properties

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* fixing version interpreted as number instead of String
by GitHub Action

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* ensure compatibility with future version of JUnit5 >=5.6.0

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* setting correct build events for the pullrequest

Multiversion Build for JUnit5 (#296)

* renaming actions to have a more concise check list

nodes.bodyText: Why 14? Default-version if Jupiter and Pioneer is 8!
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+# This workflow will build a Java project with Gradle
+# For more information see: https://help.github.com/actions/language-and-framework-guides/building-and-testing-java-with-gradle
+
+name: Experimental JUnit5 build
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches: 'master'
+    tags-ignore:
+      - 'v**'
+      - 'releaseTrigger'
+  pull_request:
+    branches: '*'
+
+jobs:
+  build:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    continue-on-error: true
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        junit5: [ '5.0', '5.1', '5.2', '6.0', '6.1', '6.2' ]
+    name: with 5.${{ matrix.junit5 }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Check out repo
+        uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Setup java
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 14

nodes.bodyText: Please revert those changes - they have nothing to do with the topic of this PR!
This is confusing because it sounds like we're building against 5.2. Calling it junitMinorVersion and adding a comment showing how the variable is used should fix that.
